TextBlock.Text: PYE: I.. I am at a loss, Idaea. Why did the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> fail?
IDAEA: Perhaps our theory was wrong. Or perhaps.. The white hole is simply not strong enough to overpower the star's gravity?
IDAEA: Would it be possible to increase the strength of the <color=orange>Sun Station's</color> white hole, Pye?
PYE: Theoretically, yes. But it would involve redesigning the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> (a painstaking process now that it is already in orbit).. Or starting over completely.
IDAEA: Worse, increasing the power of the white hole would take an exponential amount of energy - precisely why we required the supernova in the first place...
IDAEA: What if the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> opened a black hole in the sun's core instead, Pye?
PYE: If a white hole was not of sufficient strength, a black hole would not likely induce a supernova either, though miniscule amounts of solar matter may be ejected by the white hole..
PYE: I apologize, Idaea. My hypothesis was flawed.. The <color=orange>Sun Station</color> has failed.
